p: The coronavirus causing MERS (Middle East Respiratory Syndrome) was first reported in Saudi Arabia in 2012, with camels as an intermediate host [2]. Mass migration of pilgrims to and from Mecca contributed to the spread of the infection. There have been at least 2260 reported cases of confirmed MERS-CoV infection and at least 803 related deaths [2] Most patients with clinical features of MERS-CoV infection have had chronic co-morbidities [2]. Unlike SARS, MERS remains a serious infectious disease, with cases in at least 27 countries â€“ i.e., it has progressed from an epidemic to an endemic disease [2].
